content: Yes, the Mariana Trench is a very challenging place to explore due to its extreme depths and environmental conditions. To explore such depths, scientists use deep-sea submersibles such as the Trieste, which reached the bottom of the trench in 1960 or unmanned underwater vehicles (UUVs) to collect samples and data. However, humans cannot survive directly in the conditions found in such depths. The intense pressure, cold temperatures, and lack of sunlight make it impossible for human survival.
